article.headline: Lamar 91, Arkansas State 81
article.story: JONESBORO, Ark. (AP) -- Alan Daniels' 25 points and 13 rebounds sparked Lamar to a 91-81 victory Wednesday night over Arkansas State, extending the Cardinals' win streak to four games. Daniels' defensive play was also a factor in the win, as he got credit for a game-high five steals in a 40-minute performance. Lamar (5-4) trailed 41-38 at the half, but came out after intermission to take the lead. Matthew Barrow added 16 points for the Cardinals, while Brandon Chappell and Lawrence Nwevo came off the bench to score more points -- 14 by Chappell and 13 by Nwevo. Isaac Wells led the Indians' effort with 22 points and 7 rebounds. Marcus Ardison scored 17 points, Brandon Ballard added 14 and Kitus Witherspoon had 12. Both teams shot well from the field -- Lamar hit 53 percent of its shots while the Indians made 55 percent. But ASU (4-5) went only 14-of-28 from the free-throw line while the Cardinals hit 18 of their 28 foul shots, or 64 percent. The Cardinals also outrebounded the Indians, 40-27.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
